page.title: 18FLIGHTPATH
page.content: To the North West of the area, approximately 10 km away is the{ {Airfield }of St. Mawgan used by Civil Airlines as well as the R.A.F.. Approaching planes pass over the area on the flightpath. The most common planes are the regular reconnissance flights of the{Nimrods,} four engine jet powered submarine hunters with a range of over 5000 miles. They come roaring over the top of the sand tips on Hensbarrow Downs with their undercarriage down ready for landing. Occasionally the{Buccaneer}twin engined jet bombers scream in fast and low. Sometimes we spot the{Civil Aviation } Airlines, Brimon or British Airways Passenger flights flying in to land.
